text: I'll tell you candidly this was a kick
in the gut not only purporting the fort
hood community but also for our entire
army officials at Fort Hood here today
did not reveal a great deal of new
information about the shooter major
nidal malik hasan the 39 year old army
psychiatrist who was trained at walter
reed and was about to be deployed to
afghanistan the day before the shooting
he had gone to a neighbor and gave her a
copy of Quran and the next day returned
with furniture and clothing for her
saying that he wouldn't need any more he
was going to be in Iraq or Afghanistan
very little evidence about what was
going to unfold later in the day Chuck
medley the bases director of Emergency
Services the equivalent of its chief of
police said the investigation has showed
that none of the people killed were
killed by friendly fire he also
described the heroics of officer
Kimberly Munley the first officer didn't
arrive at the scene a former soldier
who's been on the bases police force
since January of 2008 he said she was
trained for exactly these kinds of
situations senator kay bailey hutchinson
said investigators are still trying to
determine whether this was the work of
one deranged individual or words or if
there were more involved meanwhile major
Manson remained hospitalized on a
ventilator but was in stable condition
and is expected to survive that'll be
important as investigators tried to
piece together what exactly caused major
Hassan to pull the trigger killing 13
people and wounding 28 others from Fort
Hood this Ray Rivera with the New York
Times
